creator: Spindizzy_Wizard@yahoo.com
text:
I have packaged my application up in a WAR file.  It consists of a 
servlet, several JSP files, and an assortment of static files.  I copy that file 
into the 'webapps' directory, and start both Tomcat and Apache.

According to the way I read the Servlet/JSP spec's, since they're all in the 
same application context (same WAR file forces same application context) they 
should share their sessions.

Not only are the JSP's not sharing session with the servlet, they aren't even 
sharing with each other!

Here's a snippet of my Tomcat output:
target   =>NOW998954792890<
ront     =>http://lvaz-lensman/horus/onts/jacupperlevelont.daml<
MMT Requested Session ID = >iijir4j6d1<
MMT Actual Session ID ...= >iijir4j6d1<
TreeView Requested Session ID = >null<
TreeView Actual Session ID ...= >zer3wkj8t1<
2001-08-27 19:27:23 - Ctx(/MMA) : Compiling: /TVCMOW.jsp to TVCMOW_0
TVCMOW Requested Session ID = >null<
TVCMOW Actual Session ID ...= >hkb4cuj8u1<

MMT is the servlet.  TreeView and TVCMOW are both JSPs.

Now, if I turn cookies completely off in my browser, the "encodeURL()" method 
takes over and adds the session everywhere.  In that case, the sessions do 
appear to be shared.

HELP!

I can't count on the users not having cookies turned on!  Feel free to request 
additional information.

I am not aware of any inherent problems with sessions that would cause what
you describe not to work. Please attach a simple web application war file that
demonstrates this problem. The simpler the better.  This will save us the time
of try to accurately recreate your problem.
